message_1: What is the net ATP yield from the complete oxidation of one molecule of glucose in glycolysis?
message_2: The net ATP yield from the complete oxidation of one molecule of glucose in glycolysis is 2 ATP molecules. During glycolysis, one glucose molecule (6 carbons) is broken down into two molecules of pyruvate (3 carbons each). In this process, 4 ATP molecules are produced, but 2 ATP molecules are consumed in the initial steps, resulting in a net gain of 2 ATP molecules.
